<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
EARNINGS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/04/24/day-good-vibes?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
It Was a Day for Good Vibes
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The temps hit the mid-70s. You rocked new sunglasses and kept them on indoors for a few minutes to make sure everyone saw. And there were even a few pleasant surprises in this packed week for corporate earnings.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Who’s celebrating?</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Twitter:</strong> Nothing like record daily users and <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/04/23/twitter-q1-2019-earnings.html" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">climbing profits</a> to prove a focus on healthy discourse is more important than an edit button. After weathering years of losses, Twitter (+15.64%) posted a <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/twitters-tweaks-boost-results-11556017253" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">sixth consecutive quarter</a> of profitability ($191 million in Q1) and investors are rushing to create @jack stan accounts.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Coca-Cola:</strong> It topped forecasts on the <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/04/23/coca-cola-q1-2019-earnings.html" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">top and bottom lines</a> after going into Q1 with pretty gloomy expectations. Coke (+1.75%) also benefited from launching new products and diversifying away from soda.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Lockheed Martin: </strong>The largest defense contractor in the world by sales grew sales even more—by 23%. It's Lockheed's (+5.66%) biggest quarterly revenue bump in more than a decade, <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/lockheed-martin-boosts-profit-guidance-11556021018" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">per the WSJ</a>. The F-35 combat jet has been getting a <em>ton </em>of interest from international customers.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Honorable mention: </strong>Snap (+1.75% after hours), which beat analyst expectations across the board and <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/snap-reports-rising-user-base-revenue-growth-11556051671?mod=hp_lead_pos12" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">added users</a> for the first time in three quarters.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">There’s a reason those beats came as a surprise</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">According to FactSet’s earnings shaman John Butters, experts predict S&P company earnings <a href="https://insight.factset.com/will-sp-500-report-an-actual-year-over-year-decline-in-earnings-in-q1-2019" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">will shrink</a> 3.9% in the first quarter once it’s all said and done. If that happens, it’ll be the first time the index reports a YoY decline in earnings since Q2 of 2016.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But that remains a big “if.”</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>As of last week, Butters found 78% of S&P companies that had already reported Q1 results </span><span><a href="https://insight.factset.com/earnings-season-update-april-18-2019" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">beat profit estimates</a></span><span>. Only about 15% have opened their books so far.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>A late-2017 tax code overhaul left corporate America flush with cash in the first quarter of last year, making for a record-breaking earnings season. This go-round won’t be quite as great...but by vaulting past expectations, earnings season has helped the major indexes close at all-time highs.</p>

<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">

Speaking of Closing at All-Time Highs

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TOBACCO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/04/24/three-formative-years?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
These Are Three Very Formative Years
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday afternoon, Rite Aid (-7.98%) <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/04/23/rite-aid-raises-tobacco-buying-age-to-21-following-walgreens-lead.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">announced</a> it will raise the minimum age to buy tobacco products in its stores to 21 from 18 within the next 90 days.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Funny...just a few hours earlier, rival Walgreens (-1.63%) announced <em>it</em> would <a href="https://www.forbes.com/sites/brucejapsen/2019/04/23/amid-fda-crackdown-walgreens-will-raise-age-to-21-for-tobacco-purchases/?utm_source=morning_brew#9a5f91244169" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">raise</a> the tobacco buying age to 21 in September. That comes a few months after the FDA put the chain “on notice” for allegedly selling tobacco products to minors.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Welcome to a bigger trend:</strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>CVS </span><span><a href="https://www.cnn.com/2014/02/05/health/cvs-cigarettes/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">banned</a></span><span> all tobacco sales in 2014.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>A dozen states and ~450 cities have raised the </span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/walgreens-to-raise-tobacco-buying-age-to-21-and-older-11556032528?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">minimum age</a></span><span> to buy tobacco to 21.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Last week, Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell said he’d introduce legislation to make the federal purchasing age 21.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">So what’s three years</strong> in the grand scheme of the No. 1 cause of preventable death? Well, <a href="https://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20190423005940/en/Rite-Aid-Raises-Age-Purchase-Tobacco-Products?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Rite Aid says</a> over 80% of adult smokers had their first cigarette <em>before</em> turning 18, and almost 95% started smoking before hitting 21. With the FDA breathing down their necks, drugstores are moving to keep Camels away from 2000s babies.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/04/24/numbers-make-go-wow?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Numbers That Make You Go...Wow
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em><img src="https://media.giphy.com/media/l0IypeKl9NJhPFMrK/giphy.gif" class="img-responsive" width="540" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 540px;" alt=""></em></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><sup class="sub-text"><a href="https://giphy.com/gifs/reactionseditor-wtf-mind-blown-l0IypeKl9NJhPFMrK/links?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Giphy</em></a><sup class="sub-text"></sup></sup></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Alternative headline: </strong>Numbers That Make You Wish You’d Invented Netflix.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The streamer’s co-founder and CEO, Reed Hastings, <a href="https://www.axios.com/netflix-reed-hastings-ceo-pay-2018-4a4c1ba7-5945-4441-8cc9-a405f31963ff.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">took home</a> almost $302 million in 2018 when you account for the actual value of the stock he cashed out during the year.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Quite the uptick from 2017, when Hastings made $179 million—that earned him the title of highest-paid CEO in the S&P 500.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Even without accounting for the shares Hastings sold throughout 2018, his compensation package <a href="https://variety.com/2019/film/news/netflix-ceo-pay-reed-hastings-ted-sarandos-1203195277/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">climbed 48%</a> to $36.1 million. And the executive behind Netflix’s <a href="https://variety.com/2019/digital/news/netflix-content-spending-2019-15-billion-1203112090/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$15 billion</a> push into original content, Ted Sarandos, pocketed $29.6 million.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Media mogul compensation...so hot right now</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Abigail Disney, activist, filmmaker, and heir to the Disney empire, made a splash last weekend after a <a href="https://twitter.com/abigaildisney/status/1119985336308912128?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">tweetstorm</a> in which she described Disney CEO Bob Iger’s $65.6 million compensation as “insane.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Abigail claimed Iger could have <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/nation/2019/04/22/disneys-ceo-made-times-much-his-employees-an-heir-disney-fortune-thinks-thats-insane/?utm_term=.e710632658a9" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">given a 15% raise</a> to everyone who works at Disneyland...and still walked away with $10 million.</p>

</a><span>  </span>
<a href="https://www.linkedin.com/shareArticle?mini=true&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2019%2F04%2F24%2Fnumbers-make-go-wow&title=Numbers+That+Make+You+Go...Wow&source=www.morningbrew.com&summary=Alternative+headline%3A+Numbers+That+Make+You+Wish+You%E2%80%99d+Invented+Netflix." target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">
<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e86576e04837.jpg">
</a><span>  </span>
</td>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SOCIAL MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/04/24/debate-sri-lanka-s-social-media-blackout?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Debate Over Sri Lanka’s Social Media Blackout
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">After Sunday’s attacks in Sri Lanka, which killed over 300 people, the Sri Lankan government <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2019/04/22/tech/social-media-sri-lanka-ban-day-two/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">cut off citizens’ access to social media</a>. It claimed it wanted to prevent the spread of disinformation, but some are saying the response was ham-fisted and could even cause more damage.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Shutting down social media can create a “vacuum of information that’s readily exploited...and can cause panic,” Alp Toker of digital rights group NetBlocks </span><span><a href="https://www.apnews.com/70978675357e481295aa07b1358cd7f0?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">told the AP</a></span><span>.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>One Sri Lankan researcher, Yudhanjaya Wijeratne, </span><span><a href="https://papers.ssrn.com/sol3/papers.cfm?abstract_id=3275106" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">has found that</a></span><span> improving alternatives and giving local laws more teeth is more effective than a blackout.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Still, <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/2019/04/23/why-some-sri-lankans-welcomed-social-media-ban-after-bombings/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">some residents thought</a> the ban was necessary to keep from spreading misleading information. And last year, Facebook was accused of <a href="https://www.buzzfeednews.com/article/meghara/we-had-to-stop-facebook-when-anti-muslim-violence-goes-viral?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">botching its response</a> to concerns about anti-Muslim speech in Sri Lanka.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">There’s important context here</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Sri Lankans aren’t exactly used to trusting their government to make speech and information choices. The country <a href="https://www.buzzfeednews.com/article/meghara/banning-social-media-in-the-wake-of-the-sri-lanka-attacks?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">has a history of censorship</a>, which was a crucial weapon in its 26-year civil war that ended only ten years ago.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2019%2F04%2F24%2Fdebate-sri-lanka-s-social-media-blackout" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">
<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e865734bf6f7.jpg">
</a><span>  </span>
<a href="https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=The+social+media+blackout%27s+been+a+topic+of+fierce+debate&url=https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/04/24/debate-sri-lanka-s-social-media-blackout&via=MorningBrew" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">
<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e86574d1eb82.jpg">
</a><span>  </span>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
INVESTING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/04/24/masayoshi-son-s-human?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Masayoshi Son’s Human After All
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">You may not have a $100 billion tech fund. And you may not even have a golf simulator in your house. But we’re <em>pretty </em>sure you didn’t lose $130 million on bitcoin like Masayoshi Son.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">According to a <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/softbank-founder-masayoshi-son-lost-130-million-on-bitcoin-11556017200?mod=hp_lead_pos7" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">WSJ report</a>, the SoftBank chief bought bitcoin near its peak in late 2017 on advice from Peter Briger, the co-chairman of Fortress Investment Group. Son reportedly sold in early 2018 for that eye-watering loss...but when you’re worth $24 billion, you just delete Coinbase and move on with your day.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>When it comes to investing, Masa likes to run the hurry-up offense:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>In 2000, all it took was a five-minute pitch from Alibaba co-founder Jack Ma to convince Son to invest $20 million. “It was the look in his eye, it was an ‘animal smell,’” </span><span><a href="https://in.reuters.com/article/alibaba-ipo-board-idINKBN0GR2A020140827?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">he said</a></span><span>.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>When raising money for his Vision Fund, Masa said that he convinced Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman to contribute </span><span><a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/explaining-softbanks-close-ties-with-saudi-arabia/2018/10/21/c5afc448-d59a-11e8-8384-bcc5492fef49_story.html?utm_term=.bc632a9149e5" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$45 billion in 45 minutes</a></span><span>—“one billion dollars per minute,” he likes to brag.   </span>
</li>
</ul>

You rocked new sunglasses and kept them on indoors for a few minutes to make sure everyone saw. And there were even a few pleasant surprises in this packed week for corporate earnings.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWho’s celebrating?\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eTwitter:\u003c/strong\u003e Nothing like record daily users and \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2019/04/23/twitter-q1-2019-earnings.html\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eclimbing profits\u003c/a\u003e to prove a focus on healthy discourse is more important than an edit button. After weathering years of losses, Twitter (+15.64%) posted a \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/twitters-tweaks-boost-results-11556017253\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esixth consecutive quarter\u003c/a\u003e of profitability ($191 million in Q1) and investors are rushing to create @jack stan accounts.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eCoca-Cola:\u003c/strong\u003e It topped forecasts on the \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2019/04/23/coca-cola-q1-2019-earnings.html\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etop and bottom lines\u003c/a\u003e after going into Q1 with pretty gloomy expectations. Coke (+1.75%) also benefited from launching new products and diversifying away from soda.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLockheed Martin: \u003c/strong\u003eThe largest defense contractor in the world by sales grew sales even more—by 23%. It's Lockheed's (+5.66%) biggest quarterly revenue bump in more than a decade, \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/lockheed-martin-boosts-profit-guidance-11556021018\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eper the WSJ\u003c/a\u003e. The F-35 combat jet has been getting a \u003cem\u003eton \u003c/em\u003eof interest from international customers.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHonorable mention: \u003c/strong\u003eSnap (+1.75% after hours), which beat analyst expectations across the board and \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/snap-reports-rising-user-base-revenue-growth-11556051671?mod=hp_lead_pos12\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eadded users\u003c/a\u003e for the first time in three quarters.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThere’s a reason those beats came as a surprise\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAccording to FactSet’s earnings shaman John Butters, experts predict S\u0026P company earnings \u003ca href=\"https://insight.factset.com/will-sp-500-report-an-actual-year-over-year-decline-in-earnings-in-q1-2019\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewill shrink\u003c/a\u003e 3.9% in the first quarter once it’s all said and done. If that happens, it’ll be the first time the index reports a YoY decline in earnings since Q2 of 2016.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut that remains a big “if.”\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eAs of last week, Butters found 78% of S\u0026P companies that had already reported Q1 results \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://insight.factset.com/earnings-season-update-april-18-2019\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebeat profit estimates\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. Only about 15% have opened their books so far.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eA late-2017 tax code overhaul left corporate America flush with cash in the first quarter of last year, making for a record-breaking earnings season. style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eannounced\u003c/a\u003e it will raise the minimum age to buy tobacco products in its stores to 21 from 18 within the next 90 days.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFunny...just a few hours earlier, rival Walgreens (-1.63%) announced \u003cem\u003eit\u003c/em\u003e would \u003ca href=\"https://www.forbes.com/sites/brucejapsen/2019/04/23/amid-fda-crackdown-walgreens-will-raise-age-to-21-for-tobacco-purchases/?utm_source=morning_brew#9a5f91244169\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eraise\u003c/a\u003e the tobacco buying age to 21 in September. That comes a few months after the FDA put the chain “on notice” for allegedly selling tobacco products to minors.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWelcome to a bigger trend:\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eCVS \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2014/02/05/health/cvs-cigarettes/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebanned\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e all tobacco sales in 2014.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eA dozen states and ~450 cities have raised the \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/walgreens-to-raise-tobacco-buying-age-to-21-and-older-11556032528?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eminimum age\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e to buy tobacco to 21.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eLast week, Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell said he’d introduce legislation to make the federal purchasing age 21.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSo what’s three years\u003c/strong\u003e in the grand scheme of the No. 1 cause of preventable death? Well, \u003ca href=\"https://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20190423005940/en/Rite-Aid-Raises-Age-Purchase-Tobacco-Products?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eRite Aid says\u003c/a\u003e over 80% of adult smokers had their first cigarette \u003cem\u003ebefore\u003c/em\u003e turning 18, and almost 95% started smoking before hitting 21. Blackout\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAfter Sunday’s attacks in Sri Lanka, which killed over 300 people, the Sri Lankan government \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2019/04/22/tech/social-media-sri-lanka-ban-day-two/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecut off citizens’ access to social media\u003c/a\u003e. It claimed it wanted to prevent the spread of disinformation, but some are saying the response was ham-fisted and could even cause more damage.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eShutting down social media can create a “vacuum of information that’s readily exploited...and can cause panic,” Alp Toker of digital rights group NetBlocks \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.apnews.com/70978675357e481295aa07b1358cd7f0?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etold the AP\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eOne Sri Lankan researcher, Yudhanjaya Wijeratne, \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://papers.ssrn.com/sol3/papers.cfm?abstract_id=3275106\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehas found that\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e improving alternatives and giving local laws more teeth is more effective than a blackout.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eStill, \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/2019/04/23/why-some-sri-lankans-welcomed-social-media-ban-after-bombings/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esome residents thought\u003c/a\u003e the ban was necessary to keep from spreading misleading information. And last year, Facebook was accused of \u003ca href=\"https://www.buzzfeednews.com/article/meghara/we-had-to-stop-facebook-when-anti-muslim-violence-goes-viral?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebotching its response\u003c/a\u003e to concerns about anti-Muslim speech in Sri Lanka.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThere’s important context here\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSri Lankans aren’t exactly used to trusting their government to make speech and information choices. The country \u003ca href=\"https://www.buzzfeednews.com/article/meghara/banning-social-media-in-the-wake-of-the-sri-lanka-attacks?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehas a history of censorship\u003c/a\u003e, which was a crucial weapon in its 26-year civil war that
